trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Rally Software | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Rally Software | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Rally Software with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Rally Software with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Rally Software
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Rally Software

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Rally Software.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Rally Software.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Rally Software tenant
trans-unit.target: A Rally Software tenant

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Rally Software
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Rally Software

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Rally Software
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Rally Software

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Rally Software.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Rally Software.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Rally Software, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Rally Software, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type rally.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type rally.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Rally Software, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Rally Software, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Rally Software</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Rally Software</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Rally Software with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Rally Software with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a certificate to Rally Software.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a certificate to Rally Software.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Rally Software **application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Rally Software **application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Rally page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Rally page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Rally Software Tenant URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "*https://\.rally.com*", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Rally Software Tenant URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "*https://\.rally.com*", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Rally page, click Download metadata, and then save it on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Rally page, click Download metadata, and then save it on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Rally Software tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Rally Software tenant.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click Setup, and then select Subscription.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click Setup, and then select Subscription.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Subscription</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Subscription</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Action button In the tool bar on the top at the right side and then select Edit Subscription.
trans-unit.target: Click the Action button In the tool bar on the top at the right side and then select Edit Subscription.

trans-unit.source: On the Subscription dialog page, perform the following steps, and then click Save & Close:
trans-unit.target: On the Subscription dialog page, perform the following steps, and then click Save & Close:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Authentication</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Authentication</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Rally or SSO authentication from Authentication dropdown
trans-unit.target: Select Rally or SSO authentication from Authentication dropdown

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Rally Software dialog page, copy the Identity Provider ID value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider URL textbox
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Rally Software dialog page, copy the Identity Provider ID value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider URL textbox

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Rally Software dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Rally Software dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: For AAD users to be able to sign in, they must be provisioned to the Rally Software application using their Azure Active Directory user names.
trans-unit.target: For AAD users to be able to sign in, they must be provisioned to the Rally Software application using their Azure Active Directory user names.

trans-unit.source: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Rally Software tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Rally Software tenant.

trans-unit.source: Go to Setup \> USERS, and then click + Add New.
trans-unit.target: Go to Setup \> USERS, and then click + Add New.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the name in the New User textbox, and then click Add with Details.
trans-unit.target: Type the name in the New User textbox, and then click Add with Details.

trans-unit.source: In the Create User section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Create User section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the User Name textbox, type the name of the Azure AD user you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the User Name textbox, type the name of the Azure AD user you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: In the Email Address textbox, type the email address of the Azure AD user you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the Email Address textbox, type the email address of the Azure AD user you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click Save & Close.
trans-unit.target: Click Save & Close.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Rally Software user account creation tools or APIs provided by Rally Software to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Rally Software user account creation tools or APIs provided by Rally Software to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Rally Software, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Rally Software, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Rally Software application integration page, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Rally Software application integration page, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
